subtitle: This dish is made in a loaf tin and inverted onto a wooden board to serve.

method.text: Heat wine in a pan until hot but not boiling. Then whisk in the gelatine. Stir until dissolved. Pour a thin layer into a 1.70 litre loaf tin. Chill until set.
Arrange tomatoes and oregano on top. Carefully spoon on a little more wine. Chill until set. Spoon over remaining wine. Chill until firm.

Put celeriac in a pan of boiling water and simmer until tender. Drain. Blend in a food processor. Add cheese, yogurt and seasoning and blend until fairly smooth. Turn into a bowl. Blend spinach in a liquidiser for about 1 min.

Add creme fraiche and seasoning, then blend until fairly smooth. Whisk gelatine into the hot stock and stir until dissolved. Gradually whisk half the stock into the celeriac and half into the spinach. Spoon half the celeriac mixture onto the wine jelly. Chill until set.
Arrange half the tomato slices on top. Spoon over the spinach mixture. Chill until set. Arrange remaining tomato slices over spinach. Top with remaining celeriac. Chill until set firm.

title: Tomato, spinach and celeriac terrine
